description.narrative: For 2014 GCE NL will work on the following activities : - Netherlands looks at EU level to ensure that the period 2014-2015 actually 20 % of the budget is spent on education, health and social protection . - Initiate and / or participate in research on ( potential ) impact of Dutch government policy on economic development , fair trade and Tax Justice policy on national investment in education , along with local GCE departments . - In cooperation with GCE International and national education coalitions and / or using existing research mapping the impact on phasing out of Dutch Government support to ( former) partner countries (including Burkina Faso ,Benin , Yemen , Zambia , Nicaragua ) and raising awareness among politicians on consequences. - Responding to relevant policy documents ( including the IOB investigation phasing effects NL bilateral programs - published in the summer of 2015) . - Provide input for and widely disseminate international reports such as GCE Education Watch Report and GPE pledge report , profiles education aid donors - Search active cooperation with other networks and coalitions for broader support for education and for greater education component under the spearheads SRHR (or in the context of the gender policy ) , and for more vocational education among other priorities . Include a seminar on the Dutch launch of the 2013/2014 Global Monitoring Report . - Organizing joint activities ( Facebook campaign , lobbying aimed at NGOs ) around the GAW 2014 Education for children with disabilities " in cooperation with the Working Group onInclusive Education of the Dutch Coalition on Disabilities and Development ( DCDD ) - Update the website as the main communication tool and forum for strengthening and broadening “Platform Education in Developing Countries” . - Use of social media ( Twitter , LinkedIn , Facebook ) to schedule discussion about the importance of education ; mobilize opinion leaders and interested groups - Provide input - oral and written - in consultations and policy debates - across the Post 2015 Development Agenda and to support and facilitate activities aimed at influencing GCE International Post 2015 calendar.

participating-org.narrative: Global Campaign for Education-Netherlands is a coalition of Oxfam Novib and Edukans (both main partners) Save the Children, Woord and Daad, Algemene Onderwijsbond and CNV Education. GCE Netherlands is a member of GCE International and has been founded in 2002.Overall objective of GCE NL is to contribute to the Education For All goals from a Dutch perspective.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services

description.narrative: no. of policy changes by governments to make available more sustainable funding (changing relation between domestic resources and aid) for quality education, also due to positive policy and behaviour of global actors (donors, ifis, companies)
